Class XMLTagsTracker

java.lang.Object
com.xml.editor.XMLTagsTracker
public class XMLTagsTracker extends Object
The XMLTagsTracker class is designed to manage and track the occurrence of XML tags. It uses a stack to keep track of opened tags and a map to record the frequency of each tag. The class provides methods for pushing and popping tags, checking the status of the stack, and determining whether tags are repeated or match specific conditions.

This class is useful for validating and managing XML structures, ensuring proper tag matching and detecting repeated or unmatched tags during XML parsing or processing.

Example usage:

     XMLTagsTracker tracker = new XMLTagsTracker();
     tracker.pushTag("<tag1>");
     tracker.pushTag("<tag2>");
     String topTag = tracker.peekTag(); // Returns "<tag2>"
     tracker.popTag(); // Pops "<tag2>"
     boolean isRepeated = tracker.isRepeatedTag("<tag1>"); // Returns true

    • XMLTagsTracker

      public XMLTagsTracker()

  • Method Details

    • pushTag

      public void pushTag(String tag)
      Pushes an opening XML tag onto the stack and updates its frequency count.
      Parameters:
      tag - the XML tag to push onto the stack.

    • popTag

      public String popTag()
      Pops the top tag from the stack and decrements its frequency count.
      Returns:
      the popped XML tag, or an empty string if the stack is empty.

    • peekTag

      public String peekTag()
      Retrieves the top tag from the stack without removing it.
      Returns:
      the top XML tag, or an empty string if the stack is empty.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the stack of XML tags is empty.
      Returns:
      true if the stack is empty, false otherwise.

    • isRepeatedTag

      public boolean isRepeatedTag(String tag)
      Checks if the given tag matches the top tag on the stack.
      Parameters:
      tag - the XML tag to compare with the top tag.
      Returns:
      true if the given tag is the same as the top tag, false otherwise.

    • isTagRepeatedOnce

      public boolean isTagRepeatedOnce(String tag)
      Checks if the given tag has been pushed onto the stack exactly once.
      Parameters:
      tag - the XML tag to check.
      Returns:
      true if the tag appears exactly once, false otherwise.

    • isTopTagMatches

      public boolean isTopTagMatches(String closeTag)
      Checks if the given closing tag matches the top opening tag on the stack.
      Parameters:
      closeTag - the closing XML tag to compare.
      Returns:
      true if the closing tag matches the top opening tag, false otherwise.

    • isTagPresent

      public boolean isTagPresent(String openTag)
      Checks if a specific opening tag is present in the stack.
      Parameters:
      openTag - the opening XML tag to check for.
      Returns:
      true if the tag is present, false otherwise.
